alert.note: Alert for Coke; Irion; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 8:46PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Coke, northeastern Tom Green and northeastern Irion Counties through 930 PM CDT... At 846 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Grape Creek, moving southeast at 20 mph. An outfloow boundary ahead of the storms will produce wind gusts to 35 to 40 mph as it moves through the city of San Angelo. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... San Angelo, Wall, Orient, San Angelo State Park, Twin Buttes Reservoir, Water Valley, Grape Creek, Goodfellow Air Force Base, Carlsbad, Veribest, Arden, O.C. Fisher Reservoir, Lake Nasworthy, Tankersley, The Intersection Of Highway 208 And Ranch Road 2662, Us- 87 Near The Coke-Tom Green County Line, Us-67 Near The Irion- Tom Green County Line and Harriet. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
